poem:
**Remembering Roy Ayers**

Even the city pauses,  
as the sun spills its light over rooftops—  
a vibraphone echoes,  
soft vibrations in alleyways,  
melting into streets.  
Roy Ayers rides the golden rhythm,  
his notes still hang in the heat,  
a toast to the warmth,  
to the sun we all embrace,  
beyond this last sunset.
